title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate real GDP per capita for Durbeville for Year 2 as $50, does not calculate real GDP per capita for Garmaston for Year 2 as $50, and/or does not show the work.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Garmaston has the higher money supply in Year 2 and/or does not explain that using the quantity theory of money ( MV=PY MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGnbGaaeOvai aab2dacaqGqbGaaeywaaaa@3D16@ ), since the two nations have the same velocity of money and Garmaston has a higher nominal GDP in Year 2, Garmaston has the higher money supply.

The response states that Garmaston has the higher money supply in Year 2 and explains that using the quantity theory of money ( MV=PY MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGnbGaaeOvai aab2dacaqGqbGaaeywaaaa@3D16@ ), since the two nations have the same velocity of money and Garmaston has a higher nominal GDP in Year 2, Garmaston has the higher money supply.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Durbeville experienced the higher real interest rate and/or does not explain that Durbeville had lower inflation and the real interest rate is equal to the nominal interest rate minus the inflation rate.

The response states that Durbeville experienced the higher real interest rate and explains that Durbeville had lower inflation and the real interest rate is equal to the nominal interest rate minus the inflation rate.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that real GDP in Garmaston will increase and/or does not explain that actual inflation is less than expected inflation, which means that the short-run aggregate supply curve will shift to the right (or the short-run Phillips curve will shift to the left) until expected inflation adjusts to actual inflation.

The response states that real GDP in Garmaston will increase and explains that actual inflation is less than expected inflation, which means that the short-run aggregate supply curve will shift to the right (or the short-run Phillips curve will shift to the left) until expected inflation adjusts to actual inflation.
